Class Pokemon

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pokemon

  • public class Pokemon
extends java.lang.Object
    Pokemon.java This class consists most of the Pokemon Logics in the PokemonArena game.
    Author:
    Charles-Jianye Chen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Pokemon.AttackInfo
      This class consists a toString() method for displaying the String repr of the attack.
      static class  Pokemon.SPECIAL
      There are 5 spcial attacks.
      static class  Pokemon.TYPE
      There are 6 types of Pokemon.

    • Field Detail

      • ID

        protected int ID

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pokemon

        public Pokemon(java.lang.String name,
               int hp,
               Pokemon.TYPE type,
               Pokemon.TYPE resistance,
               Pokemon.TYPE weakness,
               Pokemon.AttackInfo[] attacks)
        Construct a Pokemon instance.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Pokemon
        hp - the (max) health points of the Pokemon(max damage it can take)
        type - the type (of attack it offers) of the Pokemon
        resistance - the resistance type of the Pokemon
        weakness - the weakness of the Pokemon
        attacks - the AttackInfo struct of the available attacks
        See Also:
        name, hp, type, resistance, weakness, attacks, Pokemon.AttackInfo

    • Method Detail

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Fetch the Pokemon's name
        Returns:
        the name of the Pokemon(two Pokemons might have identical names though).

      • rename

        public void rename(java.lang.String name)
        Rename the Pokemon
        Parameters:
        name - the String repr of the Pokemon's new name

      • hp

        public int hp()
        Fetch the Pokemon's current health points(the amount of damage the poor fella can take before being KO’ed)
        Returns:
        the HP of the Pokemon.

      • charge_hp

        public void charge_hp(int amount)
        Charge the Pokemon's current health points. HP does not go over the health point limit.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of health points to charge into the Pokemon

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Checks if the Pokemon is still alive.
        Returns:
        true if the Pokemon is alive.

      • energy

        public int energy()
        Fetch the Pokemon's current energy points(used to pay for attacks)
        Returns:
        the energy points of the Pokemon.

      • charge_energy

        public void charge_energy(int amount)
        Charge the Pokemon's current energy points. Energy Points does not go over the limit(that is, 50).
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of energy points to charge into the Pokemon

      • type

        public Pokemon.TYPE type()
        Fetch the Pokemon's type(this val is not changed through the Pokemon's lifetime)

        The type of the Pokemon determines the type of damage it does, and thus affects weakness and resistance.

        Returns:
        the type of the Pokemon.

      • resistance

        public Pokemon.TYPE resistance()
        Fetch the Pokemon's resistance type.

        If a Pokemon is hit by a Pokemon that he is resistant to, then the damage from that attack is cut in half.

        Returns:
        the resistance type of the Pokemon.

      • weakness

        public Pokemon.TYPE weakness()
        Fetch the Pokemon's weakness type.

        If a Pokemon is hit by a Pokemon that he is resistant to, then the damage from that attack is doubled.

        Returns:
        the weakness type of the Pokemon.

      • randAtkindx

        public int randAtkindx()
        Randomly select a doable attack from all the attacks avail. to the Pokemon
        Returns:
        the atkindx(int index) of the attack / -1 if none is avail.

      • attacks

        public Pokemon.AttackInfo[] attacks()
        Fetch the copy of the array for the attacks. This is being set once only during object creation time.
        Returns:
        the copy of the existing attacks.

      • isStunned

        public boolean isStunned()
        Checks if the Pokemon is Stunned.
        Returns:
        true if the Pokemon is Stunned.

      • popStunned

        public boolean popStunned()
        Checks if the Pokemon is Stunned. Then clears the state of STUN.
        Returns:
        true if the Pokemon is Stunned.

      • isDisabled

        public boolean isDisabled()
        Checks if the Pokemon is Disabled.
        Returns:
        true if the Pokemon is Disabled.

      • specialstates

        public boolean[] specialstates()
        Fetch the copy of the array for the specialstates.
        Returns:
        the copy of the current specialstates.

      • ID

        public int ID()
        Returns the unique identifier for an instance of the Pokemon.
        Returns:
        the unique ID of the Pokemon instance.

      • affordables

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> affordables()
        Test through the list of attacks the Pokemon have. Determine the atkindx(es) that are possible to use.
        Returns:
        the list of possible attacks the Pokemon could use at this moment.
        See Also:
        testAfford(int)

      • attack

        public boolean attack(Pokemon that,
                      int atkindx)
        Attack the "that" Pokemon by "this" Pokemon through the given attack(atkindx)
        Parameters:
        that - the other pokemonn that is under attack
        atkindx - the attack to be used(the index of the attack in this#attacks())
        Returns:
        true if the attack is being done successfully.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String repr of the Pokemon with AttackInfo(s) being attached.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String repr of the Pokemon.

      • toStatusString

        public java.lang.String toStatusString()
        Returns the String repr of the Pokemon without AttackInfo(s).
        Returns:
        the String repr of the Pokemon.
